ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 17 is a challenging 15.6 km circular hike in the United Kingdom. The route forms a strenuous loop with varied terrain and significant elevation, starting and finishing at the same point.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of muddy footpaths, grassy trails, occasional rocky sections, and exposure on higher ground. Surfaces can be uneven and wet; include some climbs and descents, and be prepared for boggy or slick conditions after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Before setting out, check the forecast and daylight hours. Wear sturdy, ankle-supporting boots and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer. Bring a map and compass or a GPS device, plus a fully charged phone. Carry enough water and high-energy snacks, and include a small first aid kit, a whistle, and an emergency fleece or blanket. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time. If visibility or navigation becomes difficult, turn back and avoid taking high-risk sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with ankle support
Weather-appropriate layered clothing and a waterproof jacket
Hat, gloves, and extra warm layers for cold conditions
Water (2–3 liters depending on conditions) and high-energy snacks
Map and compass or GPS device; fully charged phone as a backup
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Lightweight emergency shelter or space blanket
Walking poles (optional but helpful on uneven terrain)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal; winter hikes are possible but shorter daylight, colder conditions and more hazards.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 17 – 15.6 km Hard Circular Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover ACW Circular Walk 17, a demanding 15.6 km loop in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and best seasons for this challenging hike.
